GOD.content: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy
GOD.linkedContent: Plato’s responsibility, or discipline, press one secret to work in service of another, put the demonic secret of Eros to work in this new hierarchy

SPOM.content: principle of selectivity guides & hierarchizes “spirits,” fatally excluding in turn, it will annihilate, by watching over some “en veillant (sur) ses ancetres” [dead bodies] and not others
SPOM.linkedContent: principle of selectivity guides & hierarchizes “spirits,” fatally excluding in turn, it will annihilate, by watching over some “en veillant (sur) ses ancetres” [dead bodies] and not others

HASD.content: where does speaker stand in relation to hierarchy [of negative theology] [see p. 65n for Derrida on Marion who distinguishes hierarchy of Theandric mystery from the “vulgar concept”: how can distance btwn the 2 give place to analogical translation of one into the other?]
HASD.linkedContent: where does speaker stand in relation to hierarchy [of negative theology] [see p. 65n for Derrida on Marion who distinguishes hierarchy of Theandric mystery from the “vulgar concept”: how can distance btwn the 2 give place to analogical translation of one into the other?]

POOF.content: in Aristotle, honor saves friendship from calculation, from the market—still, it’s proportioned via hierarchy, a hierarchy as sacralization of the beginning, qua command (arkhé)
POOF.linkedContent: in Aristotle, honor saves friendship from calculation, from the market—still, it’s proportioned via hierarchy, a hierarchy as sacralization of the beginning, qua command (arkhé)

POOF.content: prepare a ‘political’ translation of what ‘must be (il faut)’ [could never exaggerate the aporias here: to multiply anticipations & announce the heading (cap)] > distort opposition btwn heteronomy/autonomy, the phília allergic to the other (dissymmetry, infinite distance) called for it, and in this call demands a democracy to come: an alterity w/out hierarchical difference at root of democracy > this would require an equality removed from phallogocentric schema of fraternity
POOF.linkedContent: prepare a ‘political’ translation of what ‘must be (il faut)’ [could never exaggerate the aporias here: to multiply anticipations & announce the heading (cap)] > distort opposition btwn heteronomy/autonomy, the phília allergic to the other (dissymmetry, infinite distance) called for it, and in this call demands a democracy to come: an alterity w/out hierarchical difference at root of democracy > this would require an equality removed from phallogocentric schema of fraternity

POR.content: theoretico-political hierarchy w/ philosopher at top found in Kant, Schelling, Nietzsche, Heidegger, and in Aristotle’s Metaphysics > all agree that essential feature of academic responsibility must not be professional education
POR.linkedContent: theoretico-political hierarchy w/ philosopher at top found in Kant, Schelling, Nietzsche, Heidegger, and in Aristotle’s Metaphysics > all agree that essential feature of academic responsibility must not be professional education

POR.content: [re: desiring to remove the university] anarchy risks reproducing hierarchy
POR.linkedContent: [re: desiring to remove the university] anarchy risks reproducing hierarchy

A.content: death one of the names of a threat, an aporia, that risks paralyzing ontological, hierarchical, territorial apparatus to which Heidegger lends credit; death, in this sense, names what Heidegger early on called “ruination” [look up]
A.linkedContent: death one of the names of a threat, an aporia, that risks paralyzing ontological, hierarchical, territorial apparatus to which Heidegger lends credit; death, in this sense, names what Heidegger early on called “ruination” [look up]

A.content: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be

VM.content: Being is beyond hierarchies [beyond Nietzsche’s height?]
Being is not even ontology or first philosophy in the sense of rank or excellence
VM.linkedContent: Being is not even ontology or first philosophy in the sense of rank or excellence

PP.content: disappearance of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy
PP.linkedContent: disappearance of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy

OH.content: via Valéry, most interesting moment of rhetorical capitalization of “capital” (its hierarchization): regional capital always calls for always threatened universal capital
OH.linkedContent: via Valéry, most interesting moment of rhetorical capitalization of “capital” (its hierarchization): regional capital always calls for always threatened universal capital

T.content: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny
T.linkedContent: two types of mastery (phallocentrism, logocentrism): 1) hierarchy [Aristotle, Descartes, Kant, Husserl, Heidegger] 2) envelopment [Spinoza, Leibniz, Hegel] (whole in each part), system, encyclopedia, circle, homogeny

PPHS.content: sensory matter hierarchized acc. power of ideality; physical ideality as teleological anticipation, or inversely, concept and value of ideality a “metaphor” > the “history” of metaphysics; sensualist reduction & idealist teleology follow same line [circle]: “metaphor”
PPHS.linkedContent: sensory matter hierarchized acc. power of ideality; physical ideality as teleological anticipation, or inversely, concept and value of ideality a “metaphor” > the “history” of metaphysics; sensualist reduction & idealist teleology follow same line [circle]: “metaphor”

PPHS.content: [from Plato to Husserl] idealization: simultaneous confirmation of objectivity & interiority (one by the other), hierarchical classification
PPHS.linkedContent: [from Plato to Husserl] idealization: simultaneous confirmation of objectivity & interiority (one by the other), hierarchical classification

P.content: asking what art means, the vouloir-dire of art, tautology w/out reserve, logocentrism of question “What is art?”—teleology & hierarchy prescribed in envelope of this question
P.linkedContent: asking what art means, the vouloir-dire of art, tautology w/out reserve, logocentrism of question “What is art?”—teleology & hierarchy prescribed in envelope of this question

P.content: hierarchy of art constituted on the analogical model of human language
P.linkedContent: hierarchy of art constituted on the analogical model of human language

P.content: Kant’s hierarchical classification of fine arts, a humanism regulated by language & body of man, language dominated by speech & gaze
P.linkedContent: Kant’s hierarchical classification of fine arts, a humanism regulated by language & body of man, language dominated by speech & gaze

POS.content: double writing, double gesture, double science, a writing in/of itself multiple [Derrida explains that the phase of overturning the hierarchy of an opposition is necessary, politically necessary, there are risks of rushing to neutralization, but to remain w/in this phase isn’t enough]
POS.linkedContent: double writing, double gesture, double science, a writing in/of itself multiple [Derrida explains that the phase of overturning the hierarchy of an opposition is necessary, politically necessary, there are risks of rushing to neutralization, but to remain w/in this phase isn’t enough]

SP.content: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger oscillates btwn reading in Nietzsche a simple Umdrehung (inversion) of Plato or something other > neither a direct flipping, nor an an-archical erasure of hierarchy (which consolidates established order), but “a transformation of hierarchical structure itself”

FS.content: Derrida explains that by opposing force to structure he’s not envisioning an economy of pure, shapeless force > he opposes one series to the other to make apparent the noncritical privilege granted to one of the terms (structure, site, spatiality): a strategy which uses strength of field to turn its own stratagems against it > dislocate, fissure the system: le dé-limitant de part en part [delimit as describe, mark, and delimit as un-limit]
FS.linkedContent: Derrida explains that by opposing force to structure he’s not envisioning an economy of pure, shapeless force > he opposes one series to the other to make apparent the noncritical privilege granted to one of the terms (structure, site, spatiality): a strategy which uses strength of field to turn its own stratagems against it > dislocate, fissure the system: le dé-limitant de part en part [delimit as describe, mark, and delimit as un-limit]

FS.content: our discourse irreducibly belongs to system of metaphysical oppositions
FS.linkedContent: our discourse irreducibly belongs to system of metaphysical oppositions

O.content: idealist, spiritualist, phoncentrist: first and foremost logocentric (traditional, hierarchical  opposition btwn speech & writing)
O.linkedContent: idealist, spiritualist, phoncentrist: first and foremost logocentric (traditional, hierarchical opposition btwn speech & writing)

O.content: dissemination sets up a pharmacy, can’t count by 1’s, 2’s, 3’s — everything starts w/ dyad (not conflictual, hierarchical, dual oppositions)
O.linkedContent: dissemination sets up a pharmacy, can’t count by 1’s, 2’s, 3’s — everything starts w/ dyad (not conflictual, hierarchical, dual oppositions)

O.content: the 2 fictions: 1) when fiction is in service of meaning, truth is (truth of) fiction, it is low on a hierarchy, accessory to concept 2) fiction outside mimetologism affirms itself as simulacrum, disorganizes all oppositions to which teleology of book sought to violently subordinate it
O.linkedContent: the 2 fictions: 1) when fiction is in service of meaning, truth is (truth of) fiction, it is low on a hierarchy, accessory to concept 2) fiction outside mimetologism affirms itself as simulacrum, disorganizes all oppositions to which teleology of book sought to violently subordinate it

DPi.content: Plato’s Laws (907d–909d, 951d–e): nocturnal council, priests (tōn hiereōn, literally a hierarchy), a syllogos (place where one discusses together) [not a synagogue: place where one goes together] w/ minister of education, guardian of law, only those in great syllogos can visit prisoner > soteriological function of sōphronistērion (save soul)
DPi.linkedContent: Plato’s Laws (907d–909d, 951d–e): nocturnal council, priests (tōn hiereōn, literally a hierarchy), a syllogos (place where one discusses together) [not a synagogue: place where one goes together] w/ minister of education, guardian of law, only those in great syllogos can visit prisoner > soteriological function of sōphronistērion (save soul)

DPi.content: Plato describes 3 types of prisons or houses of correction
DPi.linkedContent: Plato describes 3 types of prisons or houses of correction

Gii.content: [re: Handwerk] w/out attunement to essence of wood, itself attuned to man’s dwelling: empty activity, commerce, taste for profit > (this is Heidegger’s hierarchy & evaluation)
Gii.linkedContent: [re: Handwerk] w/out attunement to essence of wood, itself attuned to man’s dwelling: empty activity, commerce, taste for profit > (this is Heidegger’s hierarchy & evaluation)

WAP.content: ever since OG, Derrida has put in question (pyramidal, synoptical) hierarchy that, in the name of the question quid juris [?], subordinates sciences & regional ontologies to an absolute logic
WAP.linkedContent: ever since OG, Derrida has put in question (pyramidal, synoptical) hierarchy that, in the name of the question quid juris [?], subordinates sciences & regional ontologies to an absolute logic

WAP.content: the force that dominates classification  & hierarchization enjoins us to read what it is interested in, and renders inaccessible what it can’t read (holds true for discourse of educator, evaluatory procedures: grading, juries, so-called supervisory committees)
WAP.linkedContent: the force that dominates classification & hierarchization enjoins us to read what it is interested in, and renders inaccessible what it can’t read (holds true for discourse of educator, evaluatory procedures: grading, juries, so-called supervisory committees)

C.content: production of paradigm via cartouche introduces necessary (fatal) perversion that cartouche alone performs > paradigm must have been preceded by its following: phantasmatics of a contingent remaining (beyond hierarchy, beyond phantasy)
C.linkedContent: production of paradigm via cartouche introduces necessary (fatal) perversion that cartouche alone performs > paradigm must have been preceded by its following: phantasmatics of a contingent remaining (beyond hierarchy, beyond phantasy)

C.content: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate
C.linkedContent: class is not lacking, it’s at work (series, lineage, rank, hierarchy, etc.) > but what doesn’t come under (n’en relève plus) class is perhaps fate (le sort) > no classification table for fate

LI.content: the way oppositions impose non-neutral hierarchies (classical logic) > eg. speech act theory’s demand for the “serious, literal, strict”
LI.linkedContent: the way oppositions impose non-neutral hierarchies (classical logic) > eg. speech act theory’s demand for the “serious, literal, strict”

LI.content: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)
LI.linkedContent: speech act theory’s hierarchical axiology: set up value oppositions & subordinate these values to each other (normal/abnormal, parasite/nonparasite, fulfilled/void, serious/nonserious, literal/nonliteral, briefly: positive/negative, ideal/nonideal)

LI.content: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)
LI.linkedContent: —Plato, Rousseau, Descartes, Husserl: good before evil, simple before complex, positive before negative, pure before impure, essential before accidental, imitated before imitation (not one metaphysical gesture among others—the metaphysical exigency)

LI.content: concept of iterability brings into the open what is disturbing or menacing the consistency of binary & hierarchical oppositions
LI.linkedContent: concept of iterability brings into the open what is disturbing or menacing the consistency of binary & hierarchical oppositions

TN.content: Bergson’s beautiful program: convergence of all the senses (still a hierarchy)
TN.linkedContent: Bergson’s beautiful program: convergence of all the senses (still a hierarchy)

TN.content: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution
TN.linkedContent: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution

E.content: proportional analogy btwn oppositions dissolves them, but first the oppositions must be produced, and there’s [almost?] always a regular hierarchy
E.linkedContent: proportional analogy btwn oppositions dissolves them, but first the oppositions must be produced, and there’s [almost?] always a regular hierarchy

E.content: Kant’s genius poet doesn’t need to know what he is writing, nature dictates what he writes, divine production > hierarchical analogy: society of logos, sociology of genius, a logoarchy
E.linkedContent: Kant’s genius poet doesn’t need to know what he is writing, nature dictates what he writes, divine production > hierarchical analogy: society of logos, sociology of genius, a logoarchy

E.content: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis
E.linkedContent: what is absolutely foreclosed from Kant’s system is not vomit but possibility of vicariousness of vomit, of its replacement by anything else: something that would undo the hierarchizing authority of logocentric analogy—its power of identification > i.e. the “in the place of,” replacement that has no proper place, no return: [the] in place of prosthesis

OG.content: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)
OG.linkedContent: totality of metaphysics creates hierarchy of signifier/signified [signified is higher, not exterior like signifier] (Christian creationism, infinitism, both appropriating Greek conceptualism)

EU.content: [re: CIPH] against pyramidal hierarchy [height?], for horizontality
